title: Dustin Martin's car is STILL parked at the MCG two weeks after the Grand Final
text:
Dustin Martin's car is still parked at the Melbourne Cricket Ground as he celebrates his premiership victory in Las Vegas.

The 28-year-old Richmond Tigers star spearheaded his side's dominant win in the AFL Grand Final on September 28, 2019.

Between his post-season celebrations and jetting off to America, Martin has been unable to drive his car home from the MCG.

Dustin Martin's car is still parked at the Melbourne Cricket Ground as he celebrates his premiership victory in Las Vegas

An MCG spokeswoman confirmed to the venue would mind Martin's car in his absence.

'With a hectic schedule between the AFL Grand Final Day and when he went overseas, Dustin Martin ran out of time to collect his car,' she told Daily Mail Australia.

'We're happy to accommodate its storage until he returns from overseas.'

Martin is in Las Vegas with close friend Dane Swan, according to The Herald Sun.

Some of Martin's teammates opted to mark their Grand Final victory by partying at Patong Beach in Thailand.

The Tigers collected their 12th flag after obliterating Greater Western Sydney Giants 114-25 in the 2019 AFL Grand Final.

Martin, who scored four goals in the 89-point humiliation, was awarded his second Norm Smith Medal for his on-pitch performance.
description: The 28-year-old Richmond Tigers star spearheaded his side's dominant win in the AFL Grand Final on September 28, 2019.
authors: Zoe Zaczek For Daily Mail Australia
